content.question: A container is filled with an ideal gas at a high gauge pressure and sealed with a cork of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that has been inserted into a circular opening of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The force exerted on the cork by the gas has magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the radii of the opening and cork are increased to <math alttext="2 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, what will be the magnitude of the new force exerted on the cork by the gas?

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
